title: Health Conditions Linked to Psoriatic Arthritis
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: People with psoriatic arthritis often have psoriasis . They tend to have or get a few other diseases, too.
There's no clear reason why these other conditions go hand in hand, and researchers are looking for the connection. It may be inflammation.

content_blocks.text: People with psoriatic arthritis often have psoriasis . They tend to have or get a few other diseases, too.
There's no clear reason why these other conditions go hand in hand, and researchers are looking for the connection. It may be inflammation.

sections.heading: 1. Cancer
content: You might be more likely to get certain types of cancer, such as lymphoma and nonmelanoma skin cancer. Research suggests it isn’t a treatment that raises your risk, but the disease itself. If you have psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis, make sure cancer screening tests are part of your regular care.

content_blocks.text: You might be more likely to get certain types of cancer, such as lymphoma and nonmelanoma skin cancer. Research suggests it isn’t a treatment that raises your risk, but the disease itself. If you have psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis, make sure cancer screening tests are part of your regular care.

sections.heading: 2. Cardiovascular (Heart) Disease
content: Some proteins related to inflammation may affect the fatty deposits, called plaque, that can build up inside blood vessels. Your heart has to work harder to move the blood. This can lead to heart disease and heart attacks .

content_blocks.text: Some proteins related to inflammation may affect the fatty deposits, called plaque, that can build up inside blood vessels. Your heart has to work harder to move the blood. This can lead to heart disease and heart attacks .

sections.heading: 3. Crohn's Disease
content: People with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis share similar genetic changes (your doctor will call them mutations) with people who have Crohn’s disease. Let your doctor know if you have symptoms of inflammatory bowel disease like diarrhea , belly cramps, and bloody poop.

content_blocks.text: People with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis share similar genetic changes (your doctor will call them mutations) with people who have Crohn’s disease. Let your doctor know if you have symptoms of inflammatory bowel disease like diarrhea , belly cramps, and bloody poop.

sections.heading: 4. Depression
content: This disease takes an emotional toll. It can lead to low self-esteem and a higher chance of mood disorders like depression. People with psoriatic arthritis may be more likely to get depression than those with psoriasis alone. Studies show that treating your psoriasis can ease your depression symptoms.

content_blocks.text: This disease takes an emotional toll. It can lead to low self-esteem and a higher chance of mood disorders like depression. People with psoriatic arthritis may be more likely to get depression than those with psoriasis alone. Studies show that treating your psoriasis can ease your depression symptoms.

sections.heading: 5. Diabetes
content: About 1 in 5 people with psoriatic arthritis also have diabetes , a lifelong disease related to high blood sugar. Being obese puts you at risk for both. Some drugs that can treat psoriatic arthritis make you more likely to get diabetes, too.

content_blocks.text: About 1 in 5 people with psoriatic arthritis also have diabetes , a lifelong disease related to high blood sugar. Being obese puts you at risk for both. Some drugs that can treat psoriatic arthritis make you more likely to get diabetes, too.

sections.heading: 6. Gout
content: Someone with psoriatic arthritis is also five times more likely to get gout , a painful type of inflammatory arthritis that happens when uric acid builds up in your body and forms crystals in your joints. It often shows up first your big toe, but it can also affect the knees and ankles.

content_blocks.text: Someone with psoriatic arthritis is also five times more likely to get gout , a painful type of inflammatory arthritis that happens when uric acid builds up in your body and forms crystals in your joints. It often shows up first your big toe, but it can also affect the knees and ankles.

sections.heading: 7. Hearing Loss
content: Psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis are both linked to hearing problems. Psoriasis can cause a sudden mild condition called sensorineural hearing loss. A study also found that a third of people with psoriatic arthritis have hearing loss compared to only about 7% of people who don't have the disease. In both cases, scientists think the body’s autoimmune system may be attacking parts of the ear just like it attacks joints.

content_blocks.text: Psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis are both linked to hearing problems. Psoriasis can cause a sudden mild condition called sensorineural hearing loss. A study also found that a third of people with psoriatic arthritis have hearing loss compared to only about 7% of people who don't have the disease. In both cases, scientists think the body’s autoimmune system may be attacking parts of the ear just like it attacks joints.

There's no clear reason why these other conditions go hand in hand, and researchers are looking for the connection. It may be inflammation.

content: Psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis are both linked to hearing problems. Psoriasis can cause a sudden mild condition called sensorineural hearing loss. A study also found that a third of people with psoriatic arthritis have hearing loss compared to only about 7% of people who don't have the disease. In both cases, scientists think the body’s autoimmune system may be attacking parts of the ear just like it attacks joints.

In both cases, scientists think the body’s autoimmune system may be attacking parts of the ear just like it attacks joints.

sections.heading: 8. High Blood Pressure
content: More than a third of people with psoriatic arthritis have high blood pressure. Your doctor might call it hypertension . Your blood pushes harder than normal against the walls of your arteries, putting stress on them.

content_blocks.text: More than a third of people with psoriatic arthritis have high blood pressure. Your doctor might call it hypertension . Your blood pushes harder than normal against the walls of your arteries, putting stress on them.

sections.heading: 9. Kidney Disease
content: People with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis are more likely to get kidney disease due to inflammation that comes along with the condition. Your doctor should keep an eye on your kidneys as part of your treatment.

content_blocks.text: People with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis are more likely to get kidney disease due to inflammation that comes along with the condition. Your doctor should keep an eye on your kidneys as part of your treatment.

sections.heading: 10, Liver Disease
content: People with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis may be more likely to get a liver condition called nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This buildup of fat in your liver can cause it to swell, which could lead to scarring (also known as cirrhosis) and liver disease or liver failure.

content_blocks.text: People with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis may be more likely to get a liver condition called nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This buildup of fat in your liver can cause it to swell, which could lead to scarring (also known as cirrhosis) and liver disease or liver failure.

sections.heading: 11. Metabolic Syndrome
content: This cluster of conditions includes heart disease, belly fat, and high blood pressure. It's closely linked to psoriatic disease. A study of more than 6,500 people found that 40% of those with psoriasis had metabolic syndrome, compared with just 23% of the general population. It was more common in women and people with severe psoriatic arthritis.

content_blocks.text: This cluster of conditions includes heart disease, belly fat, and high blood pressure. It's closely linked to psoriatic disease. A study of more than 6,500 people found that 40% of those with psoriasis had metabolic syndrome, compared with just 23% of the general population. It was more common in women and people with severe psoriatic arthritis.

sections.heading: 12. Lung Problems
content: The inflammation that comes with psoriatic arthritis can also lead to a condition known as interstitial lung disease. Symptoms include shortness of breath, coughing, and fatigue.

content_blocks.text: The inflammation that comes with psoriatic arthritis can also lead to a condition known as interstitial lung disease. Symptoms include shortness of breath, coughing, and fatigue.

sections.heading: 13. Obesity
content: Obesity is common in people with psoriatic arthritis. Some medications that treat psoriatic arthritis, such as corticosteroids, can lead to weight gain and heart disease. When you have a lot of pain and can't move easily, you probably don't like to exercise, and that can make it hard to stay at a healthy weight, too.

content_blocks.text: Obesity is common in people with psoriatic arthritis. Some medications that treat psoriatic arthritis, such as corticosteroids, can lead to weight gain and heart disease. When you have a lot of pain and can't move easily, you probably don't like to exercise, and that can make it hard to stay at a healthy weight, too.

sections.heading: 14. Stroke
content: You’re at a higher risk of stroke if you have psoriatic arthritis, so your doctor should be on the lookout for warning signs as part of your treatment.

content_blocks.text: You’re at a higher risk of stroke if you have psoriatic arthritis, so your doctor should be on the lookout for warning signs as part of your treatment.

sections.heading: 15. Uveitis
content: This inflammatory eye disease affects about 7% of people with psoriatic arthritis. Let your eye doctor know if you have symptoms, which include:
bullets: Dark, floating spots in your field of vision

content_blocks.text: This inflammatory eye disease affects about 7% of people with psoriatic arthritis. Let your eye doctor know if you have symptoms, which include:
associated_bullets: Dark, floating spots in your field of vision

sections.heading: What You Can Do
content: Work with your doctor to limit your chances of getting these conditions.
Researchers are working on ways to treat and control psoriatic arthritis, taking into account the risks for other diseases.
bullets: Keep your psoriatic arthritis under control.
Get tested for diabetes, high cholesterol , and heart disease.
Exercise regularly. Ask your doctor how to do that safely.

content_blocks.text: Work with your doctor to limit your chances of getting these conditions.

meta_description: Psoriatic arthritis raises your risk of heart disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, and other conditions. What's the link, and what can you do about it?
